intro: Erigeron hungaricus, commonly known as the Hungarian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Erigeron hungaricus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
